dict.string: Emu iOS
25847b0e1fc41bc665d204be1a2c96ee
<string> - The name of the emu used on the preview stage in the recorder onboarding flow (when user opened app for the first time)
<number> - Number indicating the user's current UIUserNotificationSettings
<date> - The date of the first time the app was launched by the user
The model of the user's device
A mnemonic name of the application. Currently: "Emu iOS". Used in case we will create white labels of the Emu app in the future.
The localized language preference on the user's device (good to know for the time we will want to localize the app).
The long build version string in the following format: <big>.<small>.<build#> for production application. or <big>.<small>.<build#>.t for test application.
The number of times the user launched the application.
The number of times the app did become active
The number of times the user shared an emu from within the app.
true if numberOfSharesUsingAppCount > 0
The number of times the user pressed "I love it" and confirmed the take in the recorder (not counting oboarding recorder)
Did the user ever finished a second retake. Opened the recorder and finished the recorder flow (disregarding oboarding)
The number of times the user navigated to a different package in the app.
True if the user ever navigated to another package in the app.
True if in the context of a messanger conversation.
The number of times keyboard did appear.
True if the keyboard ever appeared.
The number of times the alpha numeric keyboard was shown.
True if numberOfAlphaNumericKBAppearancesCount>0
The number of times the user pressed an emu in the keyboard and copied to clipboard
<string> - The name of the emu used on the preview stage in the recorder onboarding flow (when user opened app for the first time)
<date> - The date of the first time the user launched from any device.
<date> - The date of the last time the user launched from any device.
The number of times an app became active for the user from any device.
The number of times the user shared an emu from within the app from any device.
true if numberOfSharesUsingAppCount > 0
The number of times the user pressed "I love it" and confirmed the take in the recorder (not counting oboarding recorder) from any device.
Did the user ever finished a second retake. Opened the recorder and finished the recorder flow (disregarding oboarding) from any device.
The number of times keyboard did appear for the user from any device.
True if the keyboard ever appeared for the user from any device.
The number of times the user pressed an emu in the keyboard and copied to clipboard from any device.
The application was launched by the user.
The application entered the background (user pressed home screen, changed to another app, etc.)
The user launched or returned to the application.
The application was launched with a higher version than the version it was launched with previously.
<string> - the previous version the app was launched with
<string> - the current version the app was launched with
The application did become active
Facebook messenger integration opened the app using a deep link.

<string> - the type of link fb integration opened the app with. Possible value: cancel - user pressed cancel in fbm, after fbm was opened from Emu opened - user pressed Emu in the composer / discovery bar reply - user pressed the reply button in fbm
User without facebook messenger pressed the INSTALL FB Messenger option from our app.
User without facebook messenger got a "Install messenger" alert, but chosen not to install.
User asked if want to receive notifications and the user declined by pressing the "Not Now" button.
User asked if want to receive notifications and the user pressed OK.
<string> - Indicates what happened after the user pressed the OK button. Possible values:
App delegate notifications registration change
<number> - Number indicating the user's current UIUserNotificationSettings
User opened a notification in notification center and laucnhed the app
<string> - The text sent with the notification
<string> - (optional) The oid of the related package
<string> - (optional) The name of the related package
<string> - The type of the notification: local,remote
User opened iOS settings application.
<string> - The reason the user asked to open the settings app.
The recorder screen was opened and just appeared on screen. The event will also include info about the flow option the recorder was opened for.

<string> - the flow type definition the recorder was opened with. Possible values: 'onboarding' - recorder on boarding when app launched for the first time. 'retakeAll' - user wanted to retake and use the footage to all unlocked emoticons 'retakePackage' - user wanted to retake and use the footage to all unlocked emoticons in a package. 'retakeEmoticon' - user wanted to retake and lock an emoticon to a specific footage taken for that emoticon.
<string> - the name of the related emoticon (optional. only if recorder opened in the retakeEmoticon flow)
<string> - the oid of the related emoticon (optional. only if recorder opened in the retakeEmoticon flow)
<string> - the name of the related package (sent even in onboarding according to the used package set in AppCFG)
<string> - the oid of the related package (sent even in onboarding according to the used package set in AppCFG)
The user pressed the restart button that causes the recorder to restart the flow of the recorder.
user pressed (in recorder onboarding) the emu button (showing him an about emu message)

<int> - the stage this happened. Possible values: 0 - EMOnBoardingStageWelcome 1 - EMOnBoardingStageAlign 2 - EMOnBoardingStageExtractionPreview 3 - EMOnBoardingStageRecording 4 - EMOnBoardingStageFinishingUp 5 - EMOnBoardingStageReview

<int> - the stage this happened. Possible values: 0 - EMOnBoardingStageWelcome 1 - EMOnBoardingStageAlign 2 - EMOnBoardingStageExtractionPreview 3 - EMOnBoardingStageRecording 4 - EMOnBoardingStageFinishingUp 5 - EMOnBoardingStageReview
The background detection feedback UI is presented to the user. User is asked to align to silhoutte and gets feedback about bad background.
The background detection feedback UI is presented to the user. User is asked to align to silhoutte and gets feedback about bad background.
<interval> - the time interval passed since the Rec:opened event.
A threshold of good background was reached and fg extraction should start
<interval> - the time interval passed since the Rec:opened event.
The FG extraction stage has started. BG detection UI is dismissed. User can use a record button when ready.
<interval> - the time interval passed since the Rec:opened event.
User pressed the record button while real time extraction was in progress.
<int> - The latest background detection mark before user pressed the record button.
User canceled recording (by pressing the record button when it was counting down)
Recording did start.

<string> - the flow type definition the recorder was opened with. Possible values: 'onboarding' - recorder on boarding when app launched for the first time. 'retakeAll' - user wanted to retake and use the footage to all unlocked emoticons 'retakePackage' - user wanted to retake and use the footage to all unlocked emoticons in a package. 'retakeEmoticon' - user wanted to retake and lock an emoticon to a specific footage taken for that emoticon.
<string> - the name of the related emoticon (optional. only if recorder opened in the retakeEmoticon flow)
<string> - the oid of the related emoticon (optional. only if recorder opened in the retakeEmoticon flow)
<string> - the name of the related package (sent even in onboarding according to the used package set in AppCFG)
<string> - the oid of the related package (sent even in onboarding according to the used package set in AppCFG)
<interval> - the time interval passed since the Rec:opened event.
<int> - The latest background detection mark before user pressed the record button.
Recording did finish.

<string> - the flow type definition the recorder was opened with. Possible values: 'onboarding' - recorder on boarding when app launched for the first time. 'retakeAll' - user wanted to retake and use the footage to all unlocked emoticons 'retakePackage' - user wanted to retake and use the footage to all unlocked emoticons in a package. 'retakeEmoticon' - user wanted to retake and lock an emoticon to a specific footage taken for that emoticon.

<string> - the oid of the related package (sent even in onboarding according to the used package set in AppCFG)
<interval> - the time interval passed since the Rec:opened event.
<int> - The latest background detection mark before user pressed the record button.
When user asked if he likes the result he chose to try again and retake. You just can't please some people. :-(

<string> - the web url the file was downloaded from.

Background fetch
<string> - the result type of the fetch. Possible values: failed - the fetch failed newData - fetch success and new packages available noNewData - fetch success but no new packages available
<string> - (optional) oid of a package, if user notified about that newly available package.
<string> - (optional) name of a package, if user notified about that newly available package.
